title: Market Capitalization and Valuation Metrics of Comerica Inc Stock

content.text: As of the latest available data, Comerica Inc had a market capitalization of $10.53 billion. This represents the total market value of the company's outstanding shares, calculated by multiplying its current share price by the total number of shares outstanding.
Several valuation ratios can provide insights into the relative valuation of Comerica Inc compared to industry benchmarks. Here are a few relevant ratios:

The P/E ratio of Comerica Inc is an important valuation metric that compares the company's stock price to its earnings per share (EPS). As of the latest data, Comerica Inc has a P/E ratio of 11.55. This ratio indicates that investors are willing to pay 11.55 times the earnings per share for the stock.

The P/B ratio compares a company's stock price to its tangible book value per share. Comerica Inc's P/B ratio is currently 0.87. A P/B ratio below 1 may suggest that the stock is undervalued relative to its book value.

The P/S ratio compares a company's stock price to its revenue per share. Comerica Inc has a P/S ratio of 2.23. This ratio represents the amount investors are willing to pay for each dollar of the company's revenue.

Dividend yield indicates the percentage return on investment from dividends paid by the company. Comerica Inc currently has a dividend yield of 3.42%. This suggests that investors receive a return of 3.42% on their investment through dividends.

Comerica Inc's market capitalization of $10.53 billion demonstrates its size and position in the market. The valuation ratios suggest that the stock may be undervalued, as indicated by the P/B ratio below 1. However, further analysis and comparison to industry benchmarks are necessary to fully understand the company's performance and valuation.

news.headline: Comerica to Participate in Barclays Global Financial Services Conference; Announces Details for Conference Call to Review Third Quarter 2024 Earnings
news.summary: Comerica Incorporated (NYSE: CMA) announced it will participate in the 2024 Barclays Global Financial Services Conference on Tuesday, Sept. 10, 2024.

news.headline: Comerica Bank Officially Opens Great Lakes Campus, Bank's Largest Corporate Office
news.summary: Comerica Bank held a ribbon-cutting ceremony on Tuesday, Aug. 20, to celebrate the opening of its state-of-the-art collaboration and operations campus in Farmington Hills, Michigan.
